page.title: 15WILDLIFE-THE DENBIGH ESTATE
page.content: A rich{BIRD LIFE}wild ducks come in at dusk to the lakes.The lower lake has a pair of kingfishers.As well as garden birds there are both green & spotted woodpeckers,goldcrests & treecreepers in the woods next to the lakes.Flocks of fieldfare(October)were coming in for the winter,little owls hunt the same fields.Burton Pool wood,mostly conifer surrounded by a band of Hazel, is used for rearing pheasants.Around 600 birds are reared during the season & there is a shoot about once a fort- night when around 26 brace are shot. There are fox earths on the estate & it is hunted over by the Atherstone {HUNT,}most gates have jumps alongside. Many mole hills cover some fields & grey squirrels overrun the Hazel copse in the Autumn. Different varities of waterbettle are found in the overflow to the top lake.
